definitions.definition: form (something) by putting parts together or combining substances; construct; create.
examples: my grandmother made a dress for me

definitions.definition: alter something so that it forms or constitutes (something else).
examples: buffalo's milk can be made into cheese

definitions.definition: compose, prepare, or draw up (something written or abstract).
examples: she made her will

definitions.definition: prepare (a dish, drink, or meal) for consumption.
examples: she was making lunch for Lucy and Francis

definitions.definition: arrange bedclothes tidily on (a bed) ready for use.
arrange and light materials for (a fire).
complete or close (a circuit).
cause (something) to exist or come about; bring about.
examples: the drips had made a pool on the floor

definitions.definition: cause to become or seem.
examples: decorative features make brickwork more interesting

definitions.definition: carry out, perform, or produce (a specified action, movement, or sound).
examples: Unger made a speech of forty minutes
synonyms: originate; Moreliterarybeget "don't make such a noise"perform
be to blame for "I've made a mistake"utter

definitions.definition: communicate or express (an idea, request, or requirement).
examples: I tend to make heavy demands on people

definitions.definition: enter into a contract of (marriage).
examples: a marriage made in heaven

definitions.definition: appoint or designate (someone) to a position.
examples: he was made a colonel in the Mexican army

definitions.definition: represent or cause to appear in a specified way.
examples: the sale price and extended warranty make it an excellent value

definitions.definition: cause or ensure the success or advancement of.
examples: the work which really made Wordsworth's reputation

definitions.definition: compel (someone) to do something.
examples: she bought me a brandy and made me drink it
synonyms: constrain; informalrailroad "I didn't want to go but she made me"

definitions.definition: constitute; amount to.
examples: they made an unusual duo
synonyms: do duty for "the sofa makes a good bed"

definitions.definition: serve as or become through development or adaptation.
examples: this fern makes a good houseplant
synonyms: do duty for "the sofa makes a good bed"

definitions.definition: consider to be; estimate as.
examples: How many are there? I make it sixteen

definitions.definition: agree or decide on (a specified arrangement), typically one concerning a time or place.
examples: let's make it 7:30
synonyms: conclude "we've got to make a decision"

definitions.definition: gain or earn (money or profit).
examples: he'd made a lot of money out of hardware
synonyms: rake in "he's made a lot of money"

definitions.definition: arrive at (a place) within a specified time or in time for (a train or other transport).
examples: we've got a lot to do if you're going to make the shuttle
synonyms: reach; get to "he just made his train"

definitions.definition: succeed in something; become successful.
examples: he waited confidently for his band to make it
synonyms: arrive "he'll never make it as a singer"

definitions.definition: achieve a place in.
examples: these dogs seldom make the news

definitions.definition: achieve the rank of.
examples: he wasn't going to make captain

definitions.definition: go or prepare to go in a particular direction.
examples: he struggled to his feet and made toward the car

definitions.definition: act as if one is about to perform an action.
examples: she made as if to leave the room
synonyms: make out "he made as if to run away"

definitions.definition: induce (someone) to have sexual intercourse with one.
examples: he had been trying to make Cynthia for two years now

definitions.definition: (in bridge, whist, and similar games) win (a trick).
win a trick with (a card).
win the number of tricks that fulfills (a contract).
shuffle (a pack of cards) for dealing.
(of the tide) begin to flow or ebb.
